perturbation.original_text: Written notice of intention to withdraw must be served in writing upon the remaining Participants at least Thirty (30) business days prior to the withdrawal date.
perturbation.changed_text: Written notice of intention to withdraw must be served in writing upon the remaining Participants at least Ten (10) business days prior to the withdrawal date.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for withdrawal to 10 business days may be deemed unreasonable, especially considering the complexities involved in dissolving a joint venture. Florida law does not explicitly state a minimum notice period for joint venture withdrawal, a 30 day notice helps provide a sufficient time to address the operational and financial implications of a partner's departure, ensuring compliance with general fiduciary duties and fairness. Ten days might be deemed insufficient, creating grounds for legal challenges based on inadequate time for transition and potential breaches of good faith and fair dealing implied in contracts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, fiduciary duty (potential violation depending on context and harm caused).

perturbation.original_text: Regular meetings of the Participants will be held quarterly.
perturbation.changed_text: Regular meetings of the Participants will be held annually.
perturbation.explanation: Holding regular meetings only annually could be seen as a violation of the fiduciary duties of the participants, particularly concerning the oversight of the Joint Venture. Since this Joint Venture is in Florida, the participants have a responsibility to oversee the business, and only holding meetings once a year would not be considered enough time to properly take care of the business. This change might violate Florida Statute 605.409, regarding the duty of care.

perturbation.original_text: Any notices or delivery required here will be deemed completed when hand-delivered, delivered by agent, or seven (7) days after being placed in the post, postage prepaid, to the parties at the addresses contained in this Agreement or as the parties may later designate in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: Any notices or delivery required here will be deemed completed when hand-delivered, delivered by agent, or two (2) days after being placed in the post, postage prepaid, to the parties at the addresses contained in this Agreement or as the parties may later designate in writing.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notification timeframe from seven to two days after mailing creates an unreasonable timeframe. While Florida law does not explicitly mandate a specific timeframe, this reduction increases the risk that a participant may not actually receive the notice in time, especially considering possible delays in mail, undermining the fundamental fairness and potentially impacting their rights in the JV. Shortening such time, opens the door to claims of improper notice and procedural unfairness, making the contract unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.
